1.title: Why Should You Care
1.plot: Moving from Texas to Illinois for Season Two, the first episode of the second season of the Life, Well Run mini-series explores why having a professional local government manager in the community where people live and work truly matters. This episode features leaders from Lake County, Glenview, and Woodridge, Illinois.

2.title: A Lovely Place to Call Home
2.plot: This episode explores how professional local government managers improve the quality of life of residents. The communities of Glenview, Woodridge, and Lake County, IL are featured as pilot communities of ICMA's Life, Well Run Initiative.

3.title: A Partnership That Works
3.plot: This episode explores how professional local government managers help to create a business-friendly environment in Lake County, IL, and the villages of Glenview and Woodridge. These are pilot communities for ICMA's Life, Well Run Initiative.

4.title: Partnering to Create Successful Communities
4.plot: This episode explores how professional city, town, and county managers help elected officials translate policy and vision into results for their communities.

5.title: Building Communities We're Proud to Call Home
5.plot: In this episode, community leaders in Illinois speak about the value that professional local government managers bring to their communities.

6.title: A Powerful Partnership
6.plot: In this episode, community leaders in Illinois talk about how professional local government managers help elected officials further their policy goals and vision. They discuss that, by working together, they can greatly improve the quality of life in their communities.

7.title: Local Governments and Regional Partnerships
7.plot: In this, the second-to-last episode of the second and final season, community leaders and elected officials discuss how local governments can provide more services to their residents when they partner with other regional entities.

8.title: A Career Choice to Make a Difference
8.plot: In the final episode of the second season (and series finale!) of the Life, Well Run series, a forward-thinking topic is discussed. Interviewees talk about how becoming a professional local government manager can lead to a career that makes an immediate impact in people's lives.

1.title: Life, Well Run
1.plot: The flagship short episode from the Life, Well Run documentary series introduces the show by focusing on the things we take for granted and the role that professional local government management plays in building communities we're proud to call home.

2.title: Seguin Lives
2.plot: An episode serving as a teaser to the forthcoming Seguin episodes, this time-lapse montage of Seguin, TX, highlights the places that make residents of Seguin proud to call their community home. Seguin was a pilot community for ICMA's Life, Well Run Initiative.

3.title: San Antonio Lives
3.plot: An episode serving as a teaser to the forthcoming San Antonio episodes, this time-lapse montage of San Antonio, TX, highlights the places that make San Antonians proud to call their community home. San Antonio was a pilot community for ICMA's Life, Well Run Initiative.

4.title: Seguin, TX: A Proud, Professionally-Managed Community
4.plot: Community members and officials discuss professional local government management and how it makes Seguin, TX, a place they are proud to call home. Seguin was a pilot community for ICMA's Life, Well Run Initiative.

5.title: Seguin, TX: A Partnership for Success
5.plot: This episode explores how local government works in Seguin, TX: a partnership between the city manager, elected officials, business community, and residents.

6.title: San Antonio: A Partnership for Success
6.plot: This episode explores how San Antonio's elected officials work together with the city manager for the good of the city.

7.title: San Antonio: A Proud, Professionally-Managed Community
7.plot: Elected and appointed officials, along with business and civic leaders, discuss why they value professional local government management in San Antonio.

imdb.plot outline: This collection of shorts have been produced by ICMA and the Life, Well Run initiative to show raise awareness of professional local government management in America's community. They provide insight into the work of professional local government managers and the relationships between said managers and the elected officials and communities they serve. The first season was filmed in the Life, Well Run pilot communities of Seguin and San Antonio, TX. The Second season was filmed across Lake County, IL, and a few other locations around the country.
imdb.title: Life, Well Run
plot: This collection of shorts have been produced by ICMA and the _Life, Well Run_ (qv) initiative to show raise awareness of professional local government management in America's community. They provide insight into the work of professional local government managers and the relationships between said managers and the elected officials and communities they serve. The first season was filmed in the _Life, Well Run_ (qv) pilot communities of Seguin and San Antonio, TX. The Second season was filmed across Lake County, IL, and a few other locations around the country.::Nicolas DeGrazia & ICMA
